title: Smart Sprint Analytics
shortDescription: Analytics pipeline that turns Jira exports into delivery and quality dashboards.
fullDescription: Built a small data platform that ingests Jira exports, normalizes epics and stories, and publishes velocity, quality, and cycle-time dashboards. Added alerting for scope creep and regression warnings that reduced schedule misses.
problem: Teams lacked trustworthy delivery signals across multiple backlogs, causing schedule slips and unclear priorities.
solution: Automated ingestion of Jira exports, consistent epic/story taxonomy, and dashboards with trend lines and anomaly alerts.
architecture: Node ETL -> PostgreSQL warehouse -> Superset dashboards; event-driven refresh using lightweight cron workers.
challenges: Normalizing inconsistent labels and epics across teams; tuning alert thresholds to avoid noise.
results: Cut unplanned scope by 18% and improved sprint predictability; dashboards adopted by 4 squads.

title: ML Notebook Runner
shortDescription: Reproducible ML workspace with on-demand GPU runners and experiment tracking.
fullDescription: Provisioned ephemeral GPU runners for ML notebooks, wired to MLflow for metrics, artifact storage, and model registry. Introduced tagged environments (research, staging, prod) with promotion gates to cut failed deployments.
problem: Data scientists shared notebooks without reproducibility; environment drift caused rerun failures.
solution: Template-driven runners with pinned environments, GPU scheduling, and MLflow tracking baked into notebooks.
architecture: FastAPI control plane -> MLflow + S3 storage -> Terraform-managed GPU nodes; job queue for provisioning.
challenges: Balancing startup latency vs. cost; securing artifact buckets across environments.
results: Reduced setup time from hours to minutes; 40% fewer failed experiment reproductions.

title: Observability Toolkit
shortDescription: Drop-in dashboards and alerts for microservices with SLO budgeting.
fullDescription: Packaged OpenTelemetry collectors, tracing defaults, and SLO-based alerting rules for microservices. Added service maps and release overlays that cut mean time to resolution by 30%.
problem: Microservices emitted logs but had no unified tracing, making incident triage slow.
solution: Opinionated OTel configs plus Grafana dashboards and SLO alerts that teams could apply with one config block.
architecture: OTel collectors -> Prometheus + Loki -> Grafana dashboards; Terraform modules for repeatability.
challenges: Standardizing telemetry across languages; ensuring sampling didnâ€™t hurt debug depth.
results: MTTR improved by ~30%; teams adopted SLO error budgets with release overlays.

title: Portfolio Revamp
shortDescription: Design-first React portfolio with CMS-ready data layer and accessible components.
fullDescription: Implemented a component library, routed pages, and a data-driven project layer. Focused on accessibility, semantic HTML, and responsive grid layouts tailored for recruiters and hiring managers.
problem: Old portfolio required code edits for every project update, slowing outreach.
solution: JSON-driven project data with reusable cards and detail pages; added filters and search for recruiters.
architecture: Vite + React + React Router; JSON data source; hooks for filtering/search; responsive layout system.
challenges: Designing cards that balance brevity with detail; keeping filters intuitive on mobile.
results: Content updates now happen in minutes; recruiters can jump to relevant work via tags.

title: API Gateway Lite
shortDescription: Lightweight API gateway with auth, caching, and per-route rate limits.
fullDescription: Built a configurable API gateway for side projects and hackathons. Supports JWT auth, request shaping, response caching, and rate limits. Benchmarked at 15k rps on modest hardware.
problem: Side projects needed a quick API front door without paying for managed gateways.
solution: Standalone binary with pluggable middleware for auth, caching, and throttling; simple TOML config.
architecture: Rust + Actix core; Redis-backed caching; JWT validation middleware; Prometheus metrics endpoint.
challenges: Keeping latency low with layered middleware; designing a friendly config format.
results: Benchmarked at 15k rps p95<20ms on small VMs; used across three hackathon projects.

title: Recruiter Briefcase
shortDescription: One-page brief for recruiters with role-fit highlights and case studies.
fullDescription: Built a micro-site generator that assembles role-specific briefs from JSON data. Includes quick links, tailored case studies, and compact KPI snapshots to accelerate screening.
problem: Recruiters skim long portfolios; needed concise, role-specific summaries.
solution: Single-page briefs generated from JSON, with case studies, metrics, and role-fit highlights.
architecture: Next.js static generation; Notion API for content; Vercel deploys per-brief slug.
challenges: Balancing brevity with credibility; ensuring assets stay up-to-date from Notion.
results: Higher recruiter engagement; faster responses when sharing tailored briefs.
